item.title: Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road delayed to November 13
item.content:encoded:
LEVEL-5 has delayed Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road from its previously planned August 21 release date to November 13. It will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam.

“Due to the content volume exceeding our initial expectations, additional time is required for voice recording, multi-language localization, and other related processes,” LEVEL-5 said in a message. “As we work toward the final stages of development, we have decided to adjust the release date to ensure the best possible quality.

“The release date of Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road has been changed from August 21, 2025, to [November 13, 2025 (GMT)].

“We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused to all the fans who have been eagerly waiting for a long time, and truly appreciate your understanding and continued support.”

Watch a new video below.

Notice of Release Date Change



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/inazuma-eleven-victory-road-delayed-to-november-13

item.title: Wuthering Waves version 2.5 update ‘Unfading Melody of Life’ launches July 24
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Smartphone

New main quest, location, Resonator, weapon, events, and more.

Kuro Games will release the version 2.5 update for free-to-play open-world action RPG Wuthering Waves, dubbed “Unfading Melody of Life,” on July 24, the developer announced.

Here is an overview of the update:

  • New Main Quest
    • Chapter II Act VII – Dreamcatchers in the Secret Gardens
    • Overture – Rust, Sword and the Sun
  • New Location
    • Fabricatorium of the Deep
  • New Echoes
    • Reminiscence: Fenrico
    • Nightmare: Hecate
    • Nightmare: Tambourinist
    • Nightmare: Galcio Predator
    • Nightmare: Havoc Warrior
  • New Phantom Echo
    • Phantom: Nightmare Inferno Rider
  • New Sonata Effect
    • Dream of the Lost
      • 3pcs Set: Holding 0 Resonance Energy increases Crit. Rate by 20% and grants 35% Echo Skill DMG Bonus.
  • Optimizations
    • Echo Management
      • Allows you to set up Auto-Lock or Auto-Discard plans in the Data Bank. You can create management plans for Echoes based on quality, COST, Sonata Effects, and Mainstats. When a new Echo is obtained, it will automatically be locked or marked for discard according to the active plans.
    • Sync Tuning
      • The Sync Tuning option has been added to the Echo Upgrade. With the Sync Tuning option enabled, Tuners will be added automatically as you upgrade an Echo, which allows Echo Tuning to synchronize with Echo Upgrade.
    • More Preset Teams
      • Following the Version 2.5 update, you can have up to 10 preset teams.
    • On / Off Option for Resonator Skill Music
      • The Skill Music option is available for specific Resonators. It allows you to turn on or off the background music that accompanies the casting of their skills.
    • More official announcements on updates and optimizations to come!
  • New Resonator
    • Phrolova
  • Upcoming Featured Resonator Convene
    • Phase I
      • Requiem Without End
      • Stage in the Box
    • Phase II
      • Neptune’s Lullaby
      • Blaze Across the Deep
  • New Weapon
    • Lethean Elegy
  • Upcoming Featured Weapon Convene
    • Phase I
      • Lethean Elegy
      • Tragicomedy
    • Phase II
      • Whispers of Sirens
      • Unflickering Valor
  • Special Events
    • Phantasma Dreamland Echo Dreamland Leisure Event
    • Gifts of Grand Symphony 7-Day Login Event
    • Dreaming Deep Solaris Film Festival
    • Overflowing Picture Book Leisure Event
    • Deep Sea Survey Photo Collection Event
    • Wuthering Exploration Featured Event: The Border Mountains

Wuthering Waves is available now for PlayStation 5, PC via client download and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play. The PC version will also be available via Steam starting April 29.

Watch a new set of trailers below.

Version 2.5 Trailer: Unfading Melody of Life
